page.title: 17Street Names in Creeting
page.content: SALLY WOODS LANE Named after Elizabeth Woods, who, when her cottage fell into decay, stayed there with her daughter and lived in the chimney that was left. She died in 1801 aged 83. FLORDON ROAD Possibly named after Mrs. Flowerdew who used to live there. CUT THROAT LANE Was someone's throat cut there? DUNCH'S LANE Named after a benefactor of Creeting St. Mary. His charity still exists. A gift of money is given annually to elderly people of the village. ALL SAINTS ROAD Creeting St. Mary was once made up of three villages: St. Mary's, St. Olave's and All Saints. This is the main road through the village.
